column1: Kasli (Russian: Касли́) is a town and the administrative center of Kaslinsky District in Chelyabinsk Oblast
column3: located among several lakes on the eastern slope of the Middle Urals
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 16

column1: It was founded in 1747 as the settlement of Kaslinsky (Каслинский) around a foundry. Town status was granted to it on July 29
column2: 1942.The Kasli plant became famous for its cast iron castings in the mid-19th century. In 1900
column3: an open-work pavilion was molded from metal for the international exhibition. It is now exhibited in the Yekaterinburg picture gallery.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kasli serves as the administrative center of Kaslinsky District. As an administrative division
column4: together with one rural locality (the settlement of Prigorodny)
column5: incorporated within Kaslinsky District as the Town of Kasli. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Kasli is incorporated within Kaslinsky Municipal District as Kaslinskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: The leading branches of industry are non-ferrous metallurgy
column3: and metal-working. There is also a radio plant and a clothes factory.

column1: Dairy and meat farming prevails in agriculture. Potato growing is developed.
Museum of decorative castingsKasli is famous for Kasli iron sculpture—artistic figures made of cast iron. The cast sculptures of Klodt
column4: and other prominent artists are among the most famous works in the Museum of Decorative Castings. In 1860
column5: the Kasli factory was honored with the Golden Award (the small golden medal of the Free Economical Society). A year later
column6: the factory was awarded the Small Silver Medal at St. Petersburg's Textile exhibition. Honorable diplomas and silver and golden medals were awarded at the World Exhibitions in Paris (1867)

column1: Many renowned historical artistic sculptures and figures at Moscow and St. Petersburg
column2: as well as the iron furniture at the Winter Palace
column3: was produced by the Kasli factory.
